alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 4:26PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko NV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Palisade. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins between Carlin and Battle Mountains. This is about 3650 cfs. At 7.5 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding occurs from Carlin to Battle Mountain. This is about 4300 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:10 PM PDT Friday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 7.3 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 05/23/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
